node.title: [BACK-69] Improving Categories and making them more specific
node.body:
### Description of Issue ( new by @thomas-woehrle )

Compared to the first version there should be less categories. They are too fine-granular at the moment. Try to cut it down to 4-6 categories.
Prompts of first version were not ideal.

Overall there were several improvements to be made to the categorization method to be fully functional

Vague example of what i mean: https://chat.openai.com/share/48bd44b4-13a7-4ff8-9938-2214f0b17f6b
### How I implemented ( new by @thomas-woehrle  )

- adjusted getRepositoryTopics to return a list of strings rather than a string
- input to getCategoryByNumber is a list of topics and a description, but can be null
- call to GPT to get a number/multiple numbers for a project
- I use numbers instead of strings because this does leave no room for GPT to make up stuff like new category names
- transforms GPTs answer into a list of Categories

### Other ( new by @thomas-woehrle )

nodes.bodyText:
Not final yet, but I only plan to change minor things. For example return type of getCategoryNumber to number and chnage the categories.
Because we are short on time, I will set it to ready for review still

node.bodyText: Please do not disable eslint feature in this line
Same topic

Have to make this review like this because there are some problems with commenting where I want to. PR goes into a good direction.
Not comprehensive list of things that are not perfect:

categorizeProjectGeneral()  does not categorize the projects in general but in detail.
when testing it for repo gpt-engineer of AntonOsika it returns a odd category:


- test it for a few repos and see if it works
- It returns a string and not a list of categories.
remove comment
remove log
remove log
typescript supports enums btw
it's best to return null
why does this string span lines?
not sure what you mean
There is a warning, it may be fixed later.

node.title: feat: feedback flow after first payment

nodes.bodyText:
we need to store the fact we have shown this modal to the user locally (using a dedicated local mutation in apollo)
why are not using Alert api for the first modal asking for feedback?

we need to store the fact we have shown this modal to the user locally (using a dedicated local mutation in apollo)


ok, changed to alert
Is this the right documentation to follow? https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/v2/data/local-state/

@Aditi-Singh16 you can see how the theme is stored here:  https://github.com/GaloyMoney/galoy-mobile/blob/main/app/graphql/local-schema.gql#L18
And we use a local-query to fetch it at the theme-sync.ts file.

I think going straight into leaving a review might upset some people because they never agreed to do that. Are we able to give the user three options?

Yes, leave a review
Yes, skip review
No

Otherwise we could use a second modal to ask them to review us.
A quick convo with ChatGPT suggests that the standard UX is to have a secondary prompt. https://chat.openai.com/share/24eacd69-b0f3-42c0-905d-77e9559b477b
Thoughts @nicolasburtey @agbegin

I think going straight into leaving a review might upset some people because they never agreed to do that. Are we able to give the user three options?

Yes, leave a review
Yes, skip review
No

Otherwise we could use a second modal to ask them to review us.
A quick convo with ChatGPT suggests that the standard UX is to have a secondary prompt. https://chat.openai.com/share/24eacd69-b0f3-42c0-905d-77e9559b477b
Thoughts @nicolasburtey @agbegin

Should I add this flow?
Secondary prompt is already given by the OS window?

Secondary prompt is already given by the OS window?

The user does have an option to dismiss both the modals.

after switching to CustomModal

I would have the text start in the first line and not have it be centered in the middle. You should also provide a secondary button Skip in the custom modal.
For the storybook, The modal takes over the sidebar too, like it's not contained inside the screen, is this the correct behavior?
an updated video on the flow would be useful. also, please fix the typo on thank you (already commented on this 3 times!)

an updated video on the flow would be useful. also, please fix the typo on thank you (already commented on this 3 times!)

Updated the desc with the latest video

node.bodyText: this would have to be from the backend. we can't embed securely a token or username/password in a mobile app
oh okay, then should I make a PR in the galoy repo?
I would not advise for it. there is a steep learning curve on the backend so maybe console.log() the answer for now and someone with knowledge of the backend can then make the appropriate mutation.
What would be the best way to know whether it's the first payment or not?
you can fetch the list of transactions

Can you make this it's own component?
Having so much code in the screen for suggestion seems counterintuitive to me - it's better to have this as it's own component.
Perhaps make the component auto display itself if the user is receiving for the first time as well?
And the local auth query must also reside there.
The send screen as well as the home screen can just have <Suggestion ... /> in that way.
message is not correct here. the error would arise if the apollo is unable to update the value
typo
variable name does not make it clear what is active
not consistent with camelCase
stories (storybook) needed for the component
You should switch to using the CustomModal component similar to how it is being used in the SetAddressModal. This will help to ensure a consistent experience with Modals in the application.
This should be renamed to setFeedbackModalShown

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                thankyouText: "Thankyou for the feedback, would you like to suggest an improvement?",
          
          
            
                thankyouText: "Thank you for the feedback, would you like to suggest an improvement?",
You marked this as resolved, but it is still present. Do you have changes that need to be pushed?
Also the key of the field should be camel case as well, so it should be thankYouText
As part of these actions, you should log a custom firebase event called something like logAppFeedback with the parameter isEnjoingApp: boolean. You can see example in app/utils/analytics.ts
Yes, not pushed yet
you should use useSendFeedbackMutation instead. this feedback helper boilerplate is not needed

tests are not passing
boilerplate around mutation is not needed
there are still typo in the en.json (thankyou)

I don't think we need to override this? why do you think that is necessary?
having consistency across screen is important, so we would need a good reason to change the pattern

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                console.warn("unable to update status")
          
          
            
                console.warn("unable to update feedbackModalShown")
still a typo?
This should be renamed to showSuggestionModal
It seems like isFeedbackModalActive is unnecessary. In line 65 you can just call a function that calls Alert.alert directly instead of using a useEffect.

setFeedbackModalShown should be set at the same time as the Alert.alert is called in line 65. Currently it is part of the hook clean up, so there is the potential that it does not get shown because the hook gets cleaned up before the modal is shown.
The primary button should be disabled if improvement is an empty string.
marginTop and marginBottom may not be necessary here because it is already provided by the CustomModal.
This is still not resolved

I did this because of @UncleSamtoshi 's suggestion on starting the text from the first line and not have it centered.
previously it looked like this:
#2361 (comment)
Sorry for this, fixed it

Yes, I did that, but if I do that, I think I will need a local variable alertShown( but you suggested doing it without that) because, if I don't have it the alert is showing up again after a while because the state of modalShown might be changing, which causes a re-render of the component, which then triggers the useEffect hook again.
I see. I think it would be good to add back in the alertShown then.
You shouldnt disable exhaustive hooks, because it is a vector for introducing bugs.
I would rename this to feedbackModalShown
showAlert should be more descriptive. It should be something like requestFeedback

node.title: Cgi other res
node.body:
feat:
- Client Redirection Response
- Client Redirection with Document Response
- Local Redirection Response
- client.py
- test cases for these response and cgi executable file

E2E Testでclient.cppで用いていたものを利用していたが、responseをread一回で全て読み込めること前提の作りだったので、pythonでclient.pyを作り直して、execveで呼ぶ形に変更した。
host, port, method, path, body, headersを引数として与えることで任意のrequestを送信可能。
複数ヘッダーは;を区切り文字として１つの文字列としてsendRequestに渡すと勝手にパースしてくれる。

例
```
"Host:localhost;Content-Type:text/plain"
```

node.bodyText: レビュー時間かかってすみません🙏 いくつかコメントしたのでご確認いただけるとー
ディレクトリ構造はいつかリファクタしたいですね！htmlとcgi分けるみたいな
これは、一連の処理が終わった再初期化でするべきの処理のような気がしたり

Status         = "Status:" status-code SP reason-phrase NL
      status-code    = "200" | "302" | "400" | "501" | extension-code
      extension-code = 3digit
      reason-phrase  = *TEXT

のreason-phraseの部分がparseできてない気がしたり
Http RequestのURIはfragmentが付いてこないんですよね（クライアントが処理するもので、サーバーは関係ないから）`なので、、parseRequestURIはfragmentのパース出来ないです。。。
このPRの範囲じゃないですが、 recieved_data_ の方が良いかと

https://chat.openai.com/share/a341e59b-1d5a-41ba-9d65-cfafdd836233
chatGPTなんで完全信用できないですが、RFC3875の SP はsingle spaceらしいです
このfragment、uriにセットしてなくないですか？

ありがとうございます！
istringstreamの挙動を誤解してました

わざと無視して捨てているんですけど、この辺はサーバーの実装に依存するらしいです。
setしない方が変なことが起こりにくいかと思ったんですけどどっちがいいですかね？
